intro: Fagara lenticellosa, commonly known as the smooth-leaved fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various animals. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
